title: Global Third Party Logistics (3PL) Strategic Business Report 2023: Market to Reach $1.9 Trillion by 2030 ... - GlobeNewswire
summary: The global Third Party Logistics (3PL) market is projected to reach $1.9 trillion by 2030, driven by the growth of e-commerce, manufacturing and retail sectors, and the increasing adoption of advanced technologies. 3PL providers offer a range of services to help businesses manage their supply chains, including transportation, warehousing, inventory management, and value-added services. The market is expected to grow at a CAGR of 8.4% over the next eight years.
likely_naics_codes: ['488510 - Freight Transportation Arrangement', '493110 - General Warehousing and Storage', '532120 - Warehousing and Storage', '484220 - Specialized Freight Trucking']
greenwashing: The article does not mention greenwashing.

title: Packaging waste and rejected shoemaking material converted into new plastics under EU projects - Packaging Europe
summary: The LIFE programme supports two projects that collect and recycle plastic waste and convert clothing/shoe waste into polyester stable fibre. These projects aim to reduce plastic waste, promote circular economy, and conserve natural resources.
green_innovation: TRUE. The projects collect and recycle plastic waste and convert clothing/shoe waste into polyester stable fibre, contributing to environmental sustainability goals such as reducing resource consumption and promoting circular economy.
business_innovation: TRUE. The projects involve new or improved business processes for collecting, recycling, and converting waste materials, which differ significantly from previous practices.
green_product: TRUE. The recycled PET and PSF produced from waste materials can be used in the manufacturing of new products, such as shoe insoles and packaging, reducing the use of virgin materials and promoting a circular economy.
green_process: TRUE. The recycling and conversion processes employed in the projects minimize environmental impacts by reducing waste, conserving natural resources, and decreasing energy consumption.
product_or_process: LIFE RECYPACK and LIFE ECOTEX projects
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not provide any indication that the described product or process innovation is an example of greenwashing.
